channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Social Security payroll tax increase should be part of the solution
item.description: But the increase should be small and gradual

item.title: Natural Gas Prices Fall Amid Mild Temperatures
item.description: Warm U.S. weather drove down natural gas prices, despite some expectation of lower temperatures in January providing a respite.

item.title: How do the rich give away their money? With a big strategy.
item.description: Some wealthy individuals are moving hundreds of thousands of dollars out of their estates, either all at once or over time

item.title: 10 billion reasons Databricks will delay its IPO
item.description: With ample money available in private markets, Databricks, a specialist in data and artificial intelligence, is valued at $62 billion.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Fall Ahead of Fed Meeting
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes fell as the Federal Reserve was due to begin its two-day rate-setting meeting.

item.title: What's Behind Masayoshi Son's $100 Billion Pledge to Donald Trump

item.title: U.K. Sanctions Secretive Russian Oil Trading Network

item.title: Food Fight With Kroger Spells Trouble for Albertsons
item.description: Albertsons faces daunting challenges as a stand-alone company.

item.title: Palantir’s high valuation paints a stark picture of the S&P 500’s priciest picks

item.title: CVS’s stock seeing worst month in decades as drug seller gets criticism from both parties
item.description: Roles of drug “middlemen” are taking punches from the right by Donald Trump and from the left by Elizabeth Warren.
